components.description:
A restroom symbol, depicting a iconography of a man and woman. Used to indicate the location of public bathrooms / toilets / restrooms.

Used as an alternative to the water closet symbol.
components.title: Restroom

description:
A restroom symbol, depicting a iconography of a man and woman. Used to indicate the location of public bathrooms / toilets / restrooms.

Used as an alternative to the water closet symbol.
title: Restroom

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Transport And Map Symbols -> Signage and other symbols

emoji_net_data.name: restroom

bn:00099915a: Attended by members of both sexes

bn:00094275v: To be placed in an upright or vertical orientation.

bn:13669747v: To use the toilet, or assist (a child etc) in using the toilet

bn:00061450n: (plural) any group of human beings (men or women or children) collectively
Plurality of persons considered as a whole
A group of persons forming or belonging to a particular nation, class, ethnic group, country, family, etc.
Persons who exist in no programmatic feature category, or more than one category.
(plural peoples)Â  Persons forming or belonging to a particular group, such as a nation, class, ethnic group, country, family, etc; folk; community.
A group of persons forming or belonging to a particular nation etc.
A people is a plurality of persons considered as a whole, as in an ethnic group or nation.

bn:00009020n: A room or building equipped with one or more toilets
A room or building equipped with one or more toilets.
The room where human sanitation takes place, a toilet, lavatory or washroom
A toilet, especially a public one.
A toilet room is a room containing a toilet and sometimes a sink.
A public room containing a toilet.
The one that contains a toilet and sometimes a sink
A flush toilet, or the room, in a public place, containing one
A bathroom; a washroom; a room containing a toilet.

bn:00015106n: A plumbing fixture for defecation and urination
A toilet is a sanitation fixture used primarily for the disposal of human urine and feces.
A sanitation fixture used primarily for the disposal of human excrement and urine
A ceramic device used for depositing and removing human excrement with water through flushing.
A chamber pot is a bowl-shaped container with a handle, and often a lid, kept in the bedroom under a bed or in the cabinet of a nightstand and generally used as a toilet at night.

bn:00020920n: A public toilet is a room or small building containing one or more toilets and possibly also urinals which is available for use by the general public, or in a broader meaning of "public", by customers of other services.
A room or building equipped with one or more toilets.
A toilet that is available to the public
